poem:
Title: 'The Brief Blossom of Diplomacy'

On the canvas of Europe's wary face,
Hungary paints a smile of welcome red,
To Xi, a traveler in a foreign place,
Her carpet blooming beneath his tread.
Yet, a ceremonial feast can't erase
Silent reservations left unsaid,
Are served in a diplomatic vase,
In the bitter-sweet lees of politesse bred.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Hungary rolls out red carpet for Xi in final leg of European tour Hungary has rolled out the red carpet for Xi Jinping in a show of warmth that contrasts with wariness in the rest of the EU about China’s stance on trade, global politics and human rights. On the third and final stop of his first European tour in five years, Xi was given a ceremonial welcome by Hungary’s president, Tamás Sulyok, at Buda". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Hungary rolls out red carpet for Xi in final leg of European tour Hungary has rolled out the red carpet for Xi Jinping in a show of warmth that contrasts with wariness in the rest of the EU about China’s stance on trade, global politics and human rights. On the third and final stop of his first European tour in five years, Xi was given a ceremonial welcome by Hungary’s president, Tamás Sulyok, at Buda
